DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of drug-eluting balloon angioplasty followed versus conventional balloon angioplasty in superficial femoral artery and popliteal artery re-stenosis.
DOC.brief_title: Drug Eluting Balloon in Peripheral Intervention for In-Stent Restenosis
DOC.criteria: age>18 years intermittent claudication (Fontane III or IV) angiographic stenosis>50% or occlusion of superficial femoralpopliteal artery>40mm, previously treated with nitinol stent implantation, with at least one belowknee vessel to the ankle allergy to Paclitaxel contraindication for combined antiplatelet treatment life expectancy <1 year hypersensitivity or contraindication to one of the study drugs lack of consent need for amputation angiographic evidence of stent fracture
